card.question: Readers Digest is the most widely read publication in the world.
Elvis did a TV ad for a donut.
Celine Dion was named for a Canadian Prime Minister.
The word paparazzi literally means crazy fly.
NASA beamed a Beatles song to Polaris.
The old jail cell of Nelson Mandela is now a tourist attraction.
The US Marines were founded in a Philadelphia tavern
Music was initially used to soothe riders who were afraid of falling.
Recycling one glass jar saves enough energy to watch TV for 3 hours.
Your body kills 17 million red blood cells per minute.
The electric chair was invented by a dentist.
Cows are one of the main contributors to the hole in the ozone layer.
An espresso has less caffeine than a cup of coffee.
Clint Eastwood wrote many of the scores for his movies.
J.M. Barrie, author of Peter Pan was only five feet tall.
Humans shed about 600,000 particles of skin every hour.
A total eclipse of the sun happens once every 11 years.
Venus is the second planet from the sun.
There is a city called Rome on every continent.
Black olives are grown in warmer cliemates then thier green cousins.
There was no actual, rock, at Plymouth.
Tofurky is a city in the Turtle Islands.
Jackie Robinson played himself in his film bio.
Rhinoceros beetles are on of the strongest animals on the planet.
Louisiana, stems from the French work for, boot.
The Pioneer was the first spacecraft to orbit Uranus.
Narcolepsy is a fear of drugs.
Two, nibbles, make a byte in computer terminology.
The heart beat rate of a cat is twice that of humans.
A, burn card, in poker is the low end of a straight.
Honey is the only food that does not have a shelf life.
Trench coats were used, quite literally, in the trenches.
The word Arkansas mean, sturdy boat.
The world's largest silver nugget was found in Minnesota.
